metadata.label: Update Variable
metadata.description: Update the value of an existing variable

metadata.label: calendarId
metadata.description: Calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs call the calendarList.list method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the "primary" keyword

metadata.label: Payload
metadata.description: Data required to create an event

metadata.label: Fields
metadata.description: Selector specifying which fields to include in a partial response

metadata.label: Oauth Token
metadata.description: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user

metadata.label: Pretty Print
metadata.description: Returns response with indentations and line breaks

metadata.label: Quota User
metadata.description: An opaque string that represents a user for quota purposes. Must not exceed 40 characters

metadata.label: Conference Data Version
metadata.description: Version number of conference data supported by the API client. Version 0 assumes no conference data support and ignores conference data in the event's body. Version 1 enables support for copying of ConferenceData as well as for creating new conferences using the createRequest field of conferenceData. The default is 0

metadata.label: Max Attendees
metadata.description: The maximum number of attendees to include in the response. If there are more than the specified number of attendees, only the participant is returned. Optional

metadata.label: Send Updates
metadata.description: Whether to send notifications about the creation of the new event. Note that some emails might still be sent. The default is false

metadata.label: Supports Attachments
metadata.description: Whether API client performing operation supports event attachments. Optional. The default is False

metadata.label: If
metadata.description: Add conditional branch to the integration flow.

metadata.label: While
metadata.description: Loop over a block of code.

metadata.label: Match
metadata.description: Switches the data flow based on the value of an expression.

metadata.label: println
metadata.description:
Prints `any`, `error` or string templates(such as `The respective int value is ${val}`) value(s) to the STDOUT
followed by a new line.
```ballerina
io:println("Start processing the CSV file from ", srcFileName);
```

metadata.label: printInfo
metadata.description:
Prints info logs.
```ballerina
log:printInfo("info message", id = 845315)
```

metadata.label: Stack Trace
metadata.description: The error stack trace to be logged

metadata.label: run
metadata.description: Executes the agent for a given user query.

codedata.sourceCode: string agentRes = check aiAgent.run(string `${name} user asking following questions`);

metadata.label: System Prompt
metadata.description: The system prompt assigned to the agent

metadata.label: Model
metadata.description: The model used by the agent

metadata.label: Tools
metadata.description: The tools available for the agent

metadata.label: Maximum Iterations
metadata.description:
The maximum number of iterations the agent performs to complete the task.
By default, it is set to the number of tools + 1.

metadata.label: Verbose
metadata.description: Specifies whether verbose logging is enabled

metadata.label: Memory
metadata.description:
The memory used by the agent to store and manage conversation history.
Defaults to use an in-memory message store that trims on overflow, if unspecified.

metadata.label: Tool Loading Strategy
metadata.description:
Defines the strategies for loading tool schemas into an Agent. 
By default, all tools are loaded without any filtering.

metadata.label: Connection Scope
metadata.description: Scope of the connection, Global or Local

role.placeholder: e.g., Customer Support Assistant, Sales Advisor, Data Analyst

instructions.placeholder: e.g., You are a friendly assistant. Your goal is to...

metadata.label: Object
metadata.description: The object which you want to call the method on

metadata.label: Query
metadata.description: The natural language input provided to the agent

metadata.label: Session ID
metadata.description: The ID associated with the agent memory

metadata.label: Context
metadata.description: The additional context that can be used during agent tool execution

metadata.label: Td
metadata.description: Type descriptor specifying the expected return type format
